intro: [WRONG START] Walenia nemoralis, commonly known as the common wallenia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and hedgerows. The plant features basal rosettes of lance-shaped, dark green leaves with a rough texture. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually greenish-white and appear in early spring. Wallenia nemoralis is often found in association with other woodland flora and has a moderate growth rate.
